name: Path T Vulva
title: Pathologic T
notes:
**Note 1:**   FIGO does not include an in situ category for tumors of the vulva, but TNM does. Assign pTis (behavior code /2) for in situ cases. 

**Note 2:**  When both the Federation Internationale de Gynecologie et d'Obstetrique (FIGO) stage and extension information on the primary tumor are available, use the extension information to assign the T in preference to a statement of FIGO stage - see Registrar notes.
* If the only information is (pathologic) FIGO III [NOS], IIIA, IIIB, IIIC, or IVA, assign the appropriate stage and leave pathologic T, N, and M blank. If the only information is (pathologic) FIGO stage IVB, leave pathologic T and N blank and see M

**Note 3:**  FIGO Stage I, IA and IB are defined by the following
* Size of tumor 
* Involvement of vulva OR vulva and perineum
* Depth of stromal invasion

**Note 4:**  The depth of invasion is defined as the measurement of the tumor from the epithelial-stromal junction of the adjacent most superficial dermal papilla to the deepest point of invasion. (1)

**Note 5:** T3 is not used by FIGO. They label it T4. If you have a record which states T4, assign T3. (1)

**Note 6:** FIGO Stage IVA is assigned based on tumor extension and/or regional lymph node involvement.
footnotes:
(1) International Union Against Cancer (UICC) *TNM Classification of Malignant Tumors,* 7th ed., Sobin, LH, Gospodarowicz, M, Wittekind, CH, eds. New York: Wiley, 2009, pg., 198

\# T1 [NOS] is not defined in AJCC 7th edition.
rows:
Pathologic classification criteria met, evaluation done:
     Physician unable to assess T
     Surgical resection of primary tumor, extension not stated
 Physician assigns cTX, no other information available to determine T

Carcinoma in situ (preinvasive carcinoma)
Intraepithelial neoplasia Grade III (VIN III)
Tumor confined to vulva or vulva and perineum#

Note: T1 has subcategories of T1a and T1b. Assign T1 only when there is no information available to assign one of the subcategories

Vulva and perineum:  Stromal invasion but depth of invasion in millimeters not stated

Invasive carcinoma confined to:
    Musculature
    Submucosa
    Vulva including skin

Confined to the vulva and perineum, size unknown

Localized, NOS

FIGO Stage I [NOS]

Stated as T1 [NOS]
Tumor 2 cm or less in greatest dimension and with stromal invasion no greater than 1.0 mm

Vulva and perineum: Stromal invasion less than or equal to 1 mm

FIGO Stage IA

Stated as T1a
Tumor greater than 2 cm or with stromal invasion greater than 1 mm

Vulva and perineum: Stromal invasion greater than 1 mm

FIGO Stage IB

Stated as T1b

Tumor of any size with extension to adjacent perineal structures: 
    Anus
    Lower third urethra 
    Lower third vagina

Perianal skin
Urethra, NOS 
Vagina NOS

FIGO Stage II

Stated as T2

Tumor of any size with extension to the following structures:
    Bladder mucosa
    Fixed to pelvic bone
    Rectal mucosa
    Upper 2/3 urethra
    Upper 2/3 vagina

Bladder wall or bladder, NOS (including mucosa)
Perineal body
Rectal wall or rectum, NOS (including mucosa)

Further contiguous extension

Stated as T3 or T4

Primary site/histology not TNM defined
Death certificate only (DCO) case

Only information is FIGO Stage III [NOS], IIIA, IIIB, IIIC, IVA, or IVB

Pathologic classification not met
Pathologic classification criteria met, evaluation done:
    Results not documented in patient record
    No surgical resection of known primary tumor (not T0) OR
    Resection insufficient for site-specific pathologic assessment
No surgical resection of primary tumor and there isn't a positive biopsy of a structure in the highest T category and highest N category
Evidence of metastatic disease (pM1), no other workup
